meanings.definition: A consequence of an industrial or commercial activity which affects other parties without this being reflected in the cost of the goods or services involved.
meanings.sent1: The pollution from the factory is an example of externalities impacting the nearby residents.
meanings.sent2: Economists study externalities to understand the full impact of business activities on society.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected noise from the construction site created externalities for the neighborhood's peace and quiet.
meanings.sent4: The positive externalities of the new park spread joy throughout the community.
meanings.sent5: The negative externalities of the oil spill devastated the local ecosystem.

meanings.definition: A side effect or byproduct of an action that affects someone not involved in the action.
meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door created externalities for the sleeping neighbors.
meanings.sent2: Environmental conservation aims to minimize harmful externalities on wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of baking cookies had unintended externalities on the dieters in the house.
meanings.sent4: The emotional externalities of the breakup affected friends who were not part of the relationship.
meanings.sent5: The positive externalities of volunteering spread kindness to strangers.
